intro: Diodonopsis anachaeta, commonly known as the slender-leaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of white and yellow. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Diodonopsis anachaeta is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas.
